summary: This is a draft meeting agenda for a Human Trafficking meeting at the SDNY on February 15, 2019. It outlines discussion topics including the SDNY's human trafficking program statistics, the role of coordinators, specific issues like the R. Kelly case, and a planned highlight on the Epstein case.

persons.name: R. Kelly
persons.context: Mentioned under 'Issues' as a topic for conflict discussion, indicating his case was relevant to the office's workload or ethical considerations.

persons.name: E stein
persons.context: Referenced in the agenda under 'Case Highlights', indicating the Epstein case was a significant topic for discussion in the human trafficking meeting.

connections.description: Both are participants/presenters in the same SDNY Human Trafficking meeting, collaborating on the agenda.
AK is listed as presenting 'Case Highlights' which includes the Epstein case, indicating a prosecutorial or case management role.
JK is listed as discussing 'Issues' including conflicts related to the R. Kelly case, indicating a prosecutorial oversight role.

events.title: SDNY Human Trafficking Meeting
events.description: A scheduled meeting at the Southern District of New York to discuss the office's human trafficking program, case highlights including Epstein, and issues like the R. Kelly case.

keyFacts: The SDNY's Human Trafficking Program was actively handling approximately 50 investigations and 10-15 charged cases at any given time as of early 2019.
The agenda explicitly lists the Epstein case under 'Case Highlights' for discussion, indicating it was a priority case for the SDNY's human trafficking unit.
The R. Kelly case was listed as a specific 'Issue' for conflict discussion, showing it was contemporaneously active and presented potential ethical or logistical challenges for the office.
The document is internal prosecutorial correspondence, showing the operational planning within the SDNY regarding major sex trafficking cases.
